name: Spacing Scale Hierarchy
description: Spacing tokens form a consistent scale from xxs to xxxl. Hardcoded spacing values bypass the responsive scaling system and should use tokens instead.

scale.label: 2XS
scale.purpose: Minimal spacing — icon gaps, tight padding

scale.label: S
scale.purpose: Small-medium spacing — form field gaps, list item spacing

scale.label: M
scale.purpose: Medium spacing — standard component padding, section gaps

scale.label: L
scale.purpose: Large spacing — section padding, card padding

scale.label: XL
scale.purpose: Extra large spacing — major section breaks

scale.label: 2XL
scale.purpose: Maximum standard spacing — page-level vertical rhythm

scale.label: 3XL
scale.purpose: Exceptional spacing — hero sections, major page divisions

inset.purpose: Equal padding on all sides of a container

inset-squish.purpose: Padding with less vertical than horizontal space (buttons, pills)

inset-stretch.purpose: Padding with more vertical than horizontal space (tall containers)

rule: Hardcoded pixel or rem values for spacing should be replaced with spacing tokens. The spacing scale is responsive (scales with breakpoint factors), so hardcoded values break responsive behavior.
